talks.talk_title: SLMs and the Agents Revolution: Rethinking How Software Is Built
talks.description: Generative AI is rapidly changing how we build software. With powerful language models (LLMs) and the growing availability of smaller, more accessible models (SLMs), we are entering a new phase of development where intelligent agents play a central role. Just like we once moved from procedural programming to object-oriented programming, we are now moving toward a model where software is built around interactions between AI agents. In this new approach, APIs are essential. They are how agents connect to the outside world, talk to each other, and work with existing systems. In this talk, we‚Äôll look at how to design software based on agent interactions, with a special focus on how APIs make this possible. We‚Äôll explore how generative models can power agents that use APIs, expose APIs, and coordinate tasks through APIs. You‚Äôll also learn practical patterns for building systems where multiple agents collaborate effectively using clear and well-defined interfaces.

talks.talk_title: Can an AI Agent Give a Talk? Let's Find the Speaker in the Room!
talks.description: Get ready for a provocative and engaging session that challenges the very notion of who, or what, can deliver a compelling presentation! In this talk, an AI agent will be built right before your eyes. Using the Google ADK framework and Gemini, this agent will scour the internet, prepare a presentation, and then deliver it. But here's where it gets really interesting: by the end of the session, you, the audience, will choose the topic the AI agent has to talk about. This raises some fascinating questions: Can the information it presents be trusted? What does this mean for the future of knowledge and communication when an AI can 'speak' with authority? Join us to find out if an AI can truly become the speaker in the room!

talks.talk_title: In API We Trust: Circular Design for Scalable Platforms
talks.description: APIs are more than just tools; they are the foundation for building scalable and sustainable digital products. This talk explores how circular design principles can improve the way APIs are developed and used, enhancing the developer experience and delivering long-term value. Through real-world examples, we‚Äôll explore how to leverage platforms designed to enable a circular API economy that emphasizes reusability, modularity, and interoperability to drive innovation, reduce technical waste, and foster collaboration. If you‚Äôre looking to build products that not only scale but also evolve gracefully and efficiently, this talk is for you. In API we trust!

talks.talk_title: Another Cluster Bites the Dust... and That's Just Fine!
talks.description: Why keep your cluster alive when you‚Äôre not using it? Let it bite the dust, every night, and that‚Äôs just fine. With Crossplane and kube-green, you can unlock ephemeral environments that spin up when you code and shut down when you rest. Imagine a development setup that dynamically provisions complex infrastructure for testing, then automatically scales down during off-hours ‚Äì like nights and weekends. In this talk, we‚Äôll show you how Platform Engineering can orchestrate this smart, on-demand model, so developers can focus on building applications, not babysitting clusters. You‚Äôll see the integration in action, explore the impact on cost, efficiency, and sustainability, and discover how to shift from static uptime to dynamic, eco-friendly infrastructure. Save money, reduce emissions, and let your clusters rest ‚Äì because we will rock you, but not all night long.

talks.talk_title: ROUNDTABLE | When Platform Engineers Meet SREs: The Birth of Observability-as-a-Service Superpowers
talks.description: Monitoring the behavior of a system is essential to ensuring its long-term effectiveness. However, managing an end-to-end observability stack can feel like stepping into quicksand. In this talk, we‚Äôll explore how combining two worlds, developer platforms and observability, can help tackle the feeling of being off the beaten cloud native path. We‚Äôll discuss how to build paved paths, ensuring that adopting new developer tooling feels as seamless as possible.

talks.talk_title: How Platform Engineering Streamlines the End-to-End Delivery of a Self-Hosted Agentic Architecture
talks.description: In this session, we‚Äôll explore how platform engineering enables the seamless delivery of an AI-powered agentic architecture‚Äîfrom deploying open-source models to building and releasing a simple agent that interacts with real-world applications. Through a joint demo by Mia-Platform and ConfidentialMind, we‚Äôll demonstrate how a GPU-powered cluster hosts both the ConfidentialMind Control Plane and the AI models, while the Mia-Platform Console serves as the unified entry point for developers. We‚Äôll walk through the creation of a multi-tool agent built from templates available on the Mia-Platform Marketplace and powered by models deployed using the ConfidentialMind Control Plane. This agent interacts with our data to act as a shopping assistant for customers, providing product recommendations, stock availability, and suggestions for the nearest store based on the user‚Äôs location. Attendees will gain a clear understanding of how platform engineering practices simplify the complexities of AI model deployment, application development, and runtime management in a production-grade, scalable environment.

talks.talk_title: The Kubernetes Compass: Navigating Space and Time for Energy Efficiency
talks.description: As the world shifts toward renewable energy, the need to align computing workloads with the availability of green resources has never been more critical. In this talk, we‚Äôll explore how Kubernetes can serve as a ‚Äúcompass‚Äù, guiding workloads across space and time to optimize energy efficiency. By leveraging temporal shifting to align workloads with periods of peak renewable energy generation and spatial shifting to dynamically move workloads to regions with surplus green energy, we‚Äôll demonstrate strategies that not only reduce carbon footprints but also enhance cost-efficiency. Through real-world examples and practical insights, this session will showcase how temporal and spatial scheduling innovations can transform Kubernetes into a powerful tool for sustainable cloud operations. Join us to discover how to navigate the intersection of technology and sustainability, paving the way for a greener, smarter future.

talks.talk_title: Platform Engineers Assemble! Create Your FaaS Platform Using WASM
talks.description: As the technology landscape evolves and the need for adaptability to solve modern problems grows, Function-as-a-Service (FaaS) has emerged as a pivotal strategy to meet the elasticity demands of today‚Äôs systems. However, a pressing question remains: how can we make our functions truly portable, with minimal overhead, while achieving the high level of dynamism promised by FaaS? The answer already exists, and you don‚Äôt need the Infinity Gems to make it happen. All you need is wasmCloud, a CNCF incubating project, and a few tips to take the right path in building your own FaaS platform using WebAssembly (WASM). In this talk, we will dive into the world of Functions-as-a-Service, sharing insights on building a FaaS platform from the ground up with WASM and wasmCloud. We‚Äôll provide practical examples and demonstrate how to create paved paths that empower developers to build high-performance functions‚Äîeffortlessly, as if snapping their fingers.

talks.description: Monitoring the behavior of a system is essential to ensuring its long-term effectiveness. However, managing an end-to-end observability stack can feel like stepping into quicksand, without a clear plan you‚Äôre risking sinking deeper into system complexities. In this talk, we‚Äôll explore how combining two worlds‚Äîdeveloper platforms and observability‚Äîcan help tackle the feeling of being off the beaten cloud native path. We‚Äôll discuss how to build paved paths, ensuring that  adopting new developer tooling feels as seamless as possible. Further, we‚Äôll show how to avoid getting lost in the sea of telemetry data generated by our systems. Implementing the right strategies and centralizing data on a platform ensures both developers and SREs stay on top of things. Practical examples are used to map out creating your very own Internal Developer Platform (IDP) with observability integrated from day 1.

talks.talk_title: From DORA to the SPACE and Beyond: Metrics to Drive Platform Engineering Initiatives
talks.description: As a crucial part of a platform adoption journey, it‚Äôs essential to choose the right metrics to gain a clear, comprehensive view and drive success. While DORA metrics are valuable for platform teams, assessing platform adoption solely based on deployment frequency doesn‚Äôt make sense. Reflecting on our expertise, we‚Äôve learned that measuring platform success involves two types of KPIs: progress metrics and outcome metrics. In this talk, we‚Äôll explore how measuring both allows us to identify patterns and correlations between technical improvements and business success. By combining these two sets of KPIs, we gain a comprehensive view of the platform‚Äôs value. This approach helps stakeholders quantify the platform‚Äôs technical contributions while also understanding its influence on key business objectives. Ultimately, it enables us to set meaningful milestones for future improvements and effectively communicate the platform‚Äôs value across the organization.

talks.talk_title: Challenges and Takeaways of Managing AI Workloads on Cloud
talks.description: In today‚Äôs technological landscape, the synergy between Cloud Native technologies and Artificial Intelligence (AI) opens the stage to a myriad of unexplored challenges and opportunities. Dynamic, always-on and highly scalable infrastructures, typical of the Cloud Native paradigm, seamlessly integrate with AI‚Äôs need to rapidly prototype solutions and access vast computational resources. The convergence of these two worlds has exposed some gaps in the Cloud Native ecosystem that need to be addressed. At the same time, AI opens numerous opportunities for innovation that are yet to be explored. This talk will delve into the Cloud Native Artificial Intelligence (CNAI) paradigm as a holistic approach to unlocking the full potential of the cloud in managing AI workloads and aim to anticipate the growth opportunities that lie ahead for the Cloud Native world.

talks.talk_title: Platform Engineering Untold Truths: Is It Just an Infrastructure Matter?
talks.description: The increasing complexity of software development presents significant risks and inefficiencies, especially for large enterprises. That‚Äôs why companies require a structured approach to streamline software delivery, with a focus on platform engineering and internal developer platforms. While existing literature often discusses platform engineering in terms of DevOps tool integration and infrastructure provisioning, its scope extends far beyond these aspects. To truly enhance service scalability and quality, platforms must prioritize data encapsulation and composability. This means addressing not just the IT infrastructure, but the entire organizational framework. Infrastructure management represents only the tip of the iceberg; to drive a successful platform engineering initiative, factors like data management and composability are equally crucial. Let‚Äôs delve into the unspoken truths of platform engineering by examining the fundamental principles necessary for a successful platform initiative.

talks.talk_title: An Open-Source First Step to Greenify Your Cloud Environments
talks.description: In a context where the ICT sector alone produces around the 1.4% of global CO2 emissions, adopting mindful resource usage is of paramount importance. One of the most challenging aspects about green software is understanding where to start. Before delving into more complex things, a good starting point is to raise awareness of the hidden ‚Äòzombies‚Äô within our infrastructure and then proceed to eliminate them. In this session, we‚Äôll explore what green software is, its environmental and economic implications and how kube-green (an open source project listed in the CNCF landscape) immediately help us make our cloud infrastructures more sustainable.

talks.talk_title: A Policy-as-Code Approach to RBAC Authorization
talks.description: The cloud-native landscape brings incredible advantages, but it also introduces new security challenges, making safeguarding a top priority. In the traditional policy enforcement model, manual management leaves organizations vulnerable to inevitable breaches due to human error ‚Äì a matter of ‚Äòwhen,‚Äô not ‚Äòif.‚Äô Enter Policy-as-Code (PaC), a game-changing approach that leverages code to define and manage policies, transforming rules and conditions into actionable directives. By keeping policy definitions in source code control, whenever a change is made, it can be tested, validated, and then executed. The goal of PaC is not to detect policy violations but to prevent them. In this session we delve into the practical implementation of a Policy-as-Code strategy for your organization using R√∂nd and Open Policy Agent, two powerful open-source projects that could help you to redefine your security paradigm implementing an RBAC authorization mechanism over your APIs.

talks.talk_title: Finding Observability and DevEx Tranquility Sailing the Monitoring Data Seas
talks.description: In rapidly expanding cloud-native ecosystem, managing distributed architectures feels like navigating stormy seas with waves of telemetry data. Yet this data can offer vital insights to sail smoothly. This session will explore strategies to avoid drowning, improving DevEx, and more. The cloud-native ecosystem has grown exponentially in the last few years, as has the complexity of the distributed architectures being built. In a context where keeping up with technology requires a substantial amount of computational power and data, monitoring our cloud-native applications has become a constant struggle against the storm. The ever-increasing volume of traces, metrics, events, and logs generated by our systems is a double-edged sword: on one hand, if not managed correctly, becoming a distraction from needed insights. On the other hand, if approached with care and thought, providing organizations the chance to sail calm cloud-native seas. In this session, we will discover how to avoid drowning in the sea of monitoring data, instead understanding how to provide insights while using only what is needed. We will explore the emerging scenarios on the horizon, abandoning the oars and testing the waters of artificial intelligence as it applies to our observability use cases. We will discuss how to leverage monitoring data, conversational DevEx, and anomaly prediction, among other topics, in this talk.

talks.talk_title: WORKSHOP | The Game of Platforms: A Guided Journey into the World of Digital Platforms
talks.description: Platform engineering, digital platforms, platform maturity, platform-as-product‚Ä¶ When we hear these terms, we often focus on the ‚Äòwhat‚Äô: understanding what platform engineering is, what we mean by digital platforms, and what it means to apply a product mindset to platforms. However, mere knowledge of the ‚Äòwhat‚Äô is often not enough; the most curious among us have often asked about the ‚Äòhow‚Äô: how do I begin my journey into the world of digital platforms? Well, if you have ever found yourself hitting a wall when trying to understand how to start your journey in adopting a digital platform, you have found the workshop that suits you! In this interactive workshop, using a Platform Journey Map, we will play the role of a Solution Architect who has to guide real companies through their platform adoption journey. Yes, you heard that right, we will be playing, because the journey is presented as a board game where the players, our fantastic Solution Architects, must conquer spaces to mature their platform. In this workshop, we won‚Äôt just talk about digital platforms as mere orchestrators of infrastructure, but there will also be room to discuss software lifecycle, architecture modernization, business composability, and market use cases.

talks.talk_title: A Policy-as-Code Approach to RBAC Authorization
talks.description: The cloud-native landscape brings incredible advantages, but it also introduces new security challenges, making safeguarding a top priority. In the traditional policy enforcement model, manual management leaves organizations vulnerable to inevitable breaches due to human error ‚Äì a matter of ‚Äòwhen,‚Äô not ‚Äòif.‚Äô Enter Policy-as-Code (PaC), a game-changing approach that leverages code to define and manage policies, transforming rules and conditions into actionable directives. By keeping policy definitions in source code control, whenever a change is made, it can be tested, validated, and then executed. The goal of PaC is not to detect policy violations but to prevent them. In this session we delve into the practical implementation of a Policy-as-Code strategy for your organization using R√∂nd and Open Policy Agent, two powerful open-source projects that could help you to redefine your security paradigm implementing an RBAC authorization mechanism over your APIs.
